result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Doers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total costs due 6 months after release.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact, direct or indirect, with victims PG and AG, the victim's residence, or the Town of Port Washington .
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment  
Not to consume/possess any intoxicants.
Not to have any contact with any establishment that serves intoxicants.  
Submit to DNA sample by 11/19/2015 at Ozaukee Co Jail.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Court costs due during the term of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
-ADOA plus follow up counseling.
-Pay court costs in the amount of 489.90.

Defendant Thomas M Doers appears in custody by video from the Ozaukee Co Jail with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court examines defendant on Plea waiver form. Court finds defendant guilty and renders sentence. Counsel requests 109 credit if revoked; denied by Court. Counsel has 10 days to file brief regarding sentence credit.  State has 10 days after brief filed to respond.

conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants; no contact with P.G. or A.G. or residence.
Status hearing at 08-17-2015 10:00 am

State appears by Attorney Adam Gerol. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Defendant qualifies for Public Defender. Counsel waives reading. Court advises defendant of penalties. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 cash bail with conditions. Counsel requesting status on preliminary hearing; waiving time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Court orders $500 cash bail with conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants; no contact with P.G. or A.G. or residence.  Status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
